ygData.subject: Re: Pets
ygData.msgSnippet: I like this interpretation... Life is made up od uncertainties... even for a master of the arts, what if the moons were not in the right alignment? Asmoden ...
ygData.messageBody:
I like this interpretation... Life is made up od uncertainties... even for a
master of the arts, what if the moons were not in the right alignment?
Asmoden
-----Original Message-----
From: Andy <skimaster@...>
To: 'eq_necromancer@onelist.com' <eq_necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, May 09, 1999 6:01 PM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Pets


>From: Andy <skimaster@...>
>
>Personally, I believe that there is no problem with not knowing a pets
abilities. That adds to the mystery of it, because you never know(except
through a con) quite how good the skel is. It doesn't really bother me
really, cause it allows great RP situations - If it is a weakling, I will
cast Reclaim Energy on it and start muttering about the weakling undead
being summoned lately, and grumbling in general. Anyone else feel this way?
Also, I am a Gnome Necromancer on Fennin Ro. Any suggestions as to what
spells to buy at level 8? Iam right now leaning obviously to the Pet and to
Gather Shadows, and if there is a new Darkness spell I may buy that. Any
others?
>
>Leanne, level 5 Gnome Necromancer
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Star Wars fans are using ONElist to share the fun.
>http://www.onelist.com
>Are you?
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>This list is basically unmoderated. However abusive language will not be
tolerated
>
